qas.question: What scenes are depicted on the Zliten mosaic?
When was the Zliten mosaic discovered?
The mosaics uncovered in Libya were from which century?
How long was the mural discovered in Libya?
The gladiator mosaic is on par with the Alexander mosaic in which city?

context: In <a1_0>1913<a1_0/> the Zliten mosaic, a Roman mosaic famous for its many scenes from <a0_0>gladiatorial contests<a0_0/>, hunting and everyday life, was discovered in the Libyan town of Zliten. In 2000 archaeologists working in Leptis Magna, Libya, uncovered a <a3_0>30 ft<a3_0/> length of five colorful mosaics created during the <a2_0>1st or 2nd century AD<a2_0/>. The mosaics show a warrior in combat with a deer, four young men wrestling a wild bull to the ground, and a gladiator resting in a state of fatigue, staring at his slain opponent. The mosaics decorated the walls of a cold plunge pool in a bath house within a Roman villa. The gladiator mosaic is noted by scholars as one of the finest examples of mosaic art ever seen — a "masterpiece comparable in quality with the Alexander Mosaic in <a4_0>Pompeii<a4_0/>."
